questions.question: Which four items should you take into an       interview?

choices.answer: Pens, Calculator, Chewing gum, A Cell Phone
A Pencil, Pencil sharpener, Brief Case,  A  Bottle of Water
Pens, Notepad, Brief Case, and Copies of  Resume
Brief Case, A Pen, Copies of Resume, Calculator

questions.question: What are three things you should do just before your interview takes place?

choices.answer: Use the restroom, Turn off your cell phone, Use breath spray
Chew gum, Call parents for support, Drink a bottle of water
Eat a large breakfast, Drink extra coffee,Chew gum
Use the restroom, Drink 8 oz of water, Apply cologne/perfume

questions.question: You are an eccentric person applying for a professional position. Select an outfit.

choices.answer: Conservative blue suit with tie-dye peak-toe shoes
Show who you are!  Wear your nose and lip rings
Navy jacket and pants with closed toed shoes
Sequins jacket, pants, lots of large turquoise jewelry

questions.question: Don't do this when preparing for an interview:

choices.answer: Drive to the interview location to determine fastest route
Call the employer and ask a lot of questions about the job
Practice interviewing with someone
Research the company and create a list of questions

questions.question: Which will make a bad first impression during an interview?

choices.answer: Greeting the committee members with a firm handshake
Making eye contact with all committee members when speaking
Chew gum to keep your breath fresh
Be prepared to answer questions

questions.question: Which demonstrates unpreparedness for an interview?

choices.answer: Not making eye contact
Not knowing about the company or job
Saying "um" a lot during the interview
During your questioning period, ask about the start date

questions.question: Which will make you appear confident during your interview?

choices.answer: Not making good eye contact
Raising your hand often to ask questions
Taking notes during the interview
Saying "um" a lot during the interview

questions.question: You arrive 45 minutes early to the interview.  What should you do?

choices.answer: Drive away and return 10 min before the interview
Go inside and ask to begin the interview early
Go out for an everything bagel and a large coffee
Go inside and get to know the secretary and other staff

questions.question: You have a big presence on social media. Don't do this before applying for jobs:

choices.answer: Untag yourself from all Mardi Gras trip pictures
Hide any posts from you that include inappropriate language
Hide or delete any posts that are inappropriate in nature
Post "ISO a job that requires little or no work"

questions.question: What is an elevator pitch?

choices.answer: A 3 minute overview of who you are, and your strengths
A sound you make in an elevator
A 30-60 second overview of who you are, and your strengths
A conversation you have with an executive in an elevator

questions.question: How should you answer, "How would you describe yourself?'

choices.answer: Talk about your childhood and your phobias
Highlight your flaws to give a realistic portrayal
Give a concise answer that relates to the job
Say only positive things about yourself

questions.question: You cannot understand the accent of someone on the interview committee.  What do you do?

choices.answer: Say, "I can't understand you."
Ask questions and repeat what was said
Giggle
Excuse yourself and leave the interview

questions.question: You have been asked to describe the worst manager you've ever had.  How do you respond?

choices.answer: Give general answers about what makes a good vs poor manager
Name your current manager and tell all her flaws
Tell about a manager who gave you a poor work review
Never speak poorly of a former employer.

questions.question: You are very curious about the salary and benefits that come with the job.  What do you do?

choices.answer: Tell the employer the lowest salary you will accept
During your first interview ask about the salary
Wait until the end of the interview process
During the interview, tell them your salary requirements

questions.question: You are asked to describe your greatest strengths.  Don't do this:

choices.answer: Stay positive and smile while answering
Use powerful words:  Responsible,  Hard worker, Etc.
Tell a short success story about a strength of yours
Incude lots of personal strengths:  Knitting, Fishing

questions.question: You are asked to describe your greatest weaknesses.  How do you respond?

choices.answer: Explain that you aren't very productive after lunch
Tell a story about almost getting fired
Tell a story about overcoming an obstacle.
Say, "Chocolate is my greatest weakness.  HAHAHA"

questions.question: Your GPA is a 1.8.  You are asked, "Can we expect a similar performance?"

choices.answer: Give a general reason for your grades: sports, job, family
Explain that these days a 1.8 is a very good GPA
Be honest and tell them YES
Politely tell them that you take offense to the question

questions.question: You are an introvert and like working alone.  Answer, "Are you a good team member?"

choices.answer: "Yes.  I like to do my part to make the team work well"
"I'm an introvert but see value in being a good team member"
"Yes, I find it useful to get feedback from others"
"I'm an introvert and prefer to work alone"

questions.question: You have been asked your salary requirements.  How do you respond?

choices.answer: Restate your strengths & ask for 25% more than the norm
Offer a salary range
Do your homework and  be ready to provide an amount
Start with a low salary and hope that more is offered

questions.question: Don't ask the interview committee:

choices.answer: When will the job begin??
How many vacation days come with the job?
My family has mid-July vacation plans.  Is that a problem?
Why is the job vacant?

questions.question: Is it important to talk to the secretaries & maintenance staff who work where you are applying?

choices.answer: No, they are busy and don't need interruptions
Only talk to those on the interview committee
No, they are at the bottom of the totempole
Yes, their opinion of you may be taken into consideration

questions.question: If asked if you have any questions at the end of your interview, what should you do?

choices.answer: Do not ask any questions!
This is the time to ask about the salary and benefits.
Say, "Thank you but you've answered all of my questions."
Ask a genuine ? while conveying something new about you.

questions.question: Don't do this when the interview ends:

choices.answer: Shake hands with all members of the interview committee
Thank everyone for his/her time
Ask if you got the job
Write a thank you email to interview committee members

questions.question: Research shows that there is a best day and time to interview.  What is it?

choices.answer: Monday morning, 9am
Tuesday morning, 10:30am
Friday morning, 8am
Friday afternoon, 2pm

questions.question: Does the most qualified person always get the job?  Why or why not?

choices.answer: Yes, education and experience always get a person hired
No,someone can be perfect on paper and a bad match in person
Yes, as long as they are extroverted
Yes,the most qualified person is always hired
